bilateral conductive hearing losses.context: Bilateral progressive conductive hearing losses with probable otosclerosis.

otosclerosis.context: Bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.

stapedial fixation.context: Bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.

right argon laser assisted stapedectomy.context: Operation Performed: Right argon laser assisted stapedectomy.

endotracheal intubation.context: The patient was brought to the operating room. Endotracheal intubation carried out by Dr. X.

1% Xylocaine with epinephrine.context: Slow infiltration of the external canal accomplished with 1% Xylocaine with epinephrine.

earlobe infiltration.context: The earlobe was also infiltrated with the same solution.

limited incision.context: A limited incision was made in the earlobe harvesting a small bit of fat from the earlobe that was diced and the donor site closed with interrupted sutures of 5-0 nylon.

fat harvesting.context: A limited incision was made in the earlobe harvesting a small bit of fat from the earlobe that was diced and the donor site closed with interrupted sutures of 5-0 nylon.

tympanomeatal flap incision.context: A 65 Beaver blade was used to make incision both at 12 o'clock and at 6 o'clock. Jordan round knife was used to incise the tympanomeatal flap with an adequate cuff for later reapproximation.

elevation.context: Elevation was carried down to the fibrous annulus.

annulus elevator.context: An annulus elevator was used to complete the elevation beneath the annular ligament.

tympanic membrane rotation.context: The tympanic membrane and the associated flap rotated anteriorly exposing the ossicular chain.

malleus mobility.context: Palpation of the malleus revealed good mobility of both it and incus, but no movement of the stapes was identified.

incus mobility.context: Palpation of the malleus revealed good mobility of both it and incus, but no movement of the stapes was identified.

stapes mobility.context: Palpation of the malleus revealed good mobility of both it and incus, but no movement of the stapes was identified.

scutum removal.context: A house curette was used to takedown portions of the scutum with extreme care to avoid any inadvertent trauma to the chorda tympani.

chorda tympani protection.context: A house curette was used to takedown portions of the scutum with extreme care to avoid any inadvertent trauma to the chorda tympani.

argon laser application.context: The self-retaining speculum holder was used to get secure visibility and argon laser then used to create rosette on the posterior cruse.

stapes superstructure mobilization.context: The stapes superstructure anteriorly was mobilized with a right angle hook at the incostapedial joint and the superstructure could then be downfractured.

fenestration creation.context: The fenestration created in the footplate was nearly perfect for placement of the piston and therefore additional laser vaporization was not required in this particular situation.

piston placement.context: A small bit of additional footplate was removed with a right angle hook to accommodate the 0.6 mm piston. The measuring device was used and a 4.25 mm slim shaft wire Teflon piston chosen.

prosthesis attachment.context: A downbiting crimper was then used to complete the attachment of the prosthesis to the incus.

prosthesis placement.context: Prosthesis is once again checked for location and centering and appeared to be in ideal position.

fat placement.context: Small pledgets of fat were placed around the perimeter of the piston in an attempt to avoid any postoperative drainage of perilymph.

flap reapproximation.context: The flap was placed back in its normal anatomic position.

external canal packing.context: The external canal packed with small pledgets of Gelfoam and antibiotic ointment.

suture removal.context: Sutures will be out in a week.

follow-up appointment.context: A recheck in Reno in four to five weeks from now.
